meanings.definition: The act of adhering or sticking to something.
meanings.sent1: The inhesions of the sticker kept it on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The inhesions of the glue made the pieces stick together.
meanings.sent3: The inhesions of the tape were so strong, it became a challenge to remove it.
meanings.sent4: The inhesions of friendship are what hold us together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The inhesions of the magnet to the metal were surprisingly powerful.

meanings.definition: The state of being firmly attached or joined to something else.
meanings.sent1: The inhesions of the vines to the wall were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The inhesions of the Velcro ensured a secure closure.
meanings.sent3: The inhesions of the cat to its favorite spot on the couch were undeniable.
meanings.sent4: The inhesions of tradition to culture shape our beliefs and practices.
meanings.sent5: The inhesions of the roots to the soil provide stability to the tree.
